results.title: Lethal weapon 4
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Joel Silver and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In this fourth instalment of the Lethal Weapon series Mel Gibson and Danny Glover reprise their roles as Martin Riggs and Roger Murtaugh - a pair of mismatched police detectives who over the course of their relationship have learnt to love and appreciate each other’s contrasting styles. The over-the-top opening sequence establishes what the film has in store - glib throwaway lines, explosive action segments and faint hints at the importance of friendship to these two old buddies. Both Martin and Roger face a period of transition - Martin is to become a father (with Internal Affairs officer Lorna Cole - played by Rene Russo) whilst Roger is to become a grandfather. And the bad guys? Well represented by the Chinese triads who are involved with an illegal people-smuggling ring. Highlights of this film are the fight sequences, featuring Asian star Jet Li, staged by Hong Kong director Corey Yuen. Chris Rock (utilising his signature frenetic comedic shtick) plays a new cop on the block with unstinting passion for his job.

results.title: Lethal weapon 2 (Director's cut)
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Joel Silver and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Gibson and Glover reprise their roles in this sequel to the original Lethal Weapon, this time with the addition of another unforgettable character - Leo Getz (Joe Pesci). The villain this time is a South African diplomat (Joss Ackland) who doubles as a drug dealer. Though Riggs knows what’s going on, thanks to character witness Leo, he can’t touch the villain because of “diplomatic immunity.” This movie contains one of the best -and funniest- suspense scenes ever filmed: Mel Gibson agonizingly attempting to extricate a terrified Danny Glover from a booby-trapped toilet seat. There is an additional five minutes of previously unseen footage in this version.

results.title: Let your child help you
results.brief_description: This film shows how very young children may help in the every-day household chores, thus developing a sense of accomplishment and responsibility while they increase their skill and co-ordination.

results.title: Let there be light
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: the theme of light - natural and man-made - is explored in this film aimed at all levels of the primary school. Depicts, without commentary, all kinds and applications of light from a match to a flame.

results.title: Let there be light
results.creator_credit: John Huston and Department of Defense
results.brief_description: Produced by the American Department of Defence and banned for 35 years, this documentary deals with the treatment of soldiers suffering from war-induced psychotic and psychosomatic disorders. The camera records a wide range of emotional disabilities among the returning World War II veterans at Mason General Hospital at Long Island. Looks at the various methods of treatment which include hypnosis and truth-inducing drugs. The original purpose of the film was to convince the public, employers in particular, that soldiers suffering from neuro-psychiatric damage could be rehabilitated and resume civilian life. After seeing the finished product, the War Department withdrew the film for various reasons among them the invasion of the patients’ privacy and the fear that it would scare off potential recruit. Narrated by Walter Huston. Cinematography by Stanley Cortez.

results.title: Let them come with rain
results.creator_credit: Martin Bunnel, Bill Brind, George Movshon and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Botawana, land-locked in southern Africa, is now taking the painful early steps towards modern nationhood. Much of Botswana is the Kalahari Desert, Botswana’s new leaders look to their vast mineral resources from which to gain a key to the industrial future her people want.

results.title: Let the balloon go (K)
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Richard Mason and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Set in a small Australian outback town in 1917, this is the story of a young boy who is determined to fight against the limitations imposed upon him because of his physical disabilities. Based on the novel of the same name by Ivan Southall. Cinematography by Dean Semler.
